name: Add Arabic language if we do not have it to languages in the system.

elements.name: Check that create new account options does not appear for anonymous users.

steps.name: I should not see "Create new account"

elements.name: Check that only admin can create an account.
Verify that anonymous users cannot access admin pages.

name: Website Base Requirements - User Registration - Only admins login
description:
As an anonymous user
I will not be able to register as a user in the website
So that I will need a site admin or super admin to add me to the website

elements.name: Check that all default list of roles are present.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user

name: Website Base Requirements - User Roles - Simple Roles
description:
As a logged in user with the User ID number 1
I want to be able to see the list of User Roles
So that they must be (Editor, Site Admin, Content Admin, Super Admin)

elements.name: Check that an anonymous user can reset his/her password.
Verify that the system cannot send an email to non-existing users/emails.

steps.name: I should see "Username or email address"
I fill in "not.existing.email@vardot.com" for "Username or email address"
I should see "Further instructions have been sent to your e-mail address."

name: User Management - Standard User Management - Request new password
description:
As a user with a ready user account
I will want to be able to Request new password
So that I can reset my password for the account

elements.name: Check if site admin can translate an existing English Basic Page

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Test English Basic page" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test English Basic page body"
I should see "Test English Basic page"
I should see "Test English Basic page body"
I should see "Translations of Test English Basic page"
I should see "Not translated" in the "Arabic" row
I should see "Create Arabic translation of Test English Basic page"
I fill in "تجربة صفحة بسيطة عربية العنوان" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "تجربة صفحة بسيطة عربية المحتوى"
I should see "تجربة صفحة بسيطة عربية العنوان"
I should see "Test English Basic page"

name: Website Base Requirements - Website Languages - All content translatable to all languages
description:
As a logged in user with a permission to translate content
I want to be able to check if all content types are translatable
So that I will be able to create a content then I will have the option to translate the content to other languages in the site

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user

elements.name: Check if admins can see the "Add user" button under People administration page.

elements.name: Delete the Tester user.

steps.name: I fill in "Tester" for "Name or email contains"
I should see "Are you sure you want to cancel the account Tester?"
I select the radio button "Delete the account and its content."

name: User Management - Standard User Management - Admins can create users and assign a role to them
description:
As a site admin user
I want to be able create new user accounts and assign roles to them
So that they will be able to use the site.

elements.name: Check if we can Create Basic page with English for the language of the content.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_content_admin" user
I fill in "Test English Basic page title by content admin" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test English Basic page body"
I should see "Test English Basic page title by content admin"

elements.name: Check if we can Create Landing page with English for the language of the content.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_content_admin" user
I fill in "Test English Landing page title by content admin" for "Title"
I should see "Test English Landing page title by content admin"

elements.name: Check if we can Create Basic page with English for the language of the content.

I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test English Basic page body"
I should see "Test English Basic page title by site admin"

elements.name: Check if we can Create Landing page with English for the language of the content.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Test English Landing page title by site admin" for "Title"
I should see "Test English Landing page title by site admin"

name: Website Base Requirements - Website Languages - English
description:
As a logged in user with the permission to add content
I want to be able to check if the site has got the English language Enabled
So that can be sure that the website is using the English language as one of the languages.

elements.name: Check if a visitor can login with a valid username and password.
Verify a form error after not entering the username or password when we login.

steps.name: I should see "Username field is required"
I should see "Password field is required"

name: User Management - Standard User Management - Login
description:
As a visitor with an existing user account
I want to be able to login to the site
So that I will be able to view/add/edit/ or delete content in the site

elements.name: Check if inserted raw URL will convert into a link using the "Rich editor" text format when we save a new Basic page.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Test convert URLs" for "Title"

I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "

Test line #1
Test line #2 http://drupal.org
Test line #3

"
I click "http://drupal.org" in the "a" element with the "href" attribute set to "http://drupal.org"

name: Content Editing - Rich Text Editor - Convert URLs into links
description:
As a logged in user with a permission to use the rich text editor
I want to add raw URLs and links in the rich text editor
So that they will be converted to links and visitors can click on them.

elements.name: Check if inserted raw URL will convert into a link when we save when
elements.description: We are using the "Visual editor" text format.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Linking to internal content #1 title" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Linking to internal content #1 body"
I should see "Linking to internal content #1 body"

elements.name: Check if inserted raw URL will convert into a link when we save when
elements.description: We are using the "Visual editor" text format.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Linking to internal content #2 title" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with " Linking to internal content #2 body "
I click on "linkit" command button in the rich text editor field "Body"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I press the " " key in the "Link" field
I press the "t" key in the "Link" field
I press the "o" key in the "Link" field
I press the "enter" key in the "Link" field
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see "Linking to internal content #1 title"
I click "Linking to internal content #1 title" in the "ul" element with the "class" attribute set to "ui-autocomplete"
I should not see "Linking to internal content #1 title"

name: Content Editing - Rich Text Editor - Easy linking to internal content by searching for content by its titles
description:
As a content admin
I want to be able to add internal links searching the title of an internal content
So that will ease the work of adding internal links in the rich text editor fields.

elements.name: Check if Site Admin user can change the text format for the body of Basic page.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see the "#cke_edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see the "#cke_edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see the "#edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"
I should not see the "#cke_edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"

elements.name: Check if Super Admin user can change the text format for the body of Basic page.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_super_admin"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see the "#cke_edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see the "#cke_edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see the "#edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"
I should not see the "#cke_edit-body-0-value" element in the "field body"

name: Content Editing - Rich Text Editor - Input formats
description:
As a logged in user with a permission to edit content
I want to be able to switch between input formats
So that can use different type of rich text editors.

the "Panelize this view mode" checkbox should not be checked

So that the "Basic page" will show up in the structured menu under its parent page

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_super_admin" user

elements.name: Create the "Test Basic page to embed existing files" content.

steps.name: I fill in "Test Basic page to embed existing files" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test Basic page body to embed existing files"
I should see "Basic page Test Basic page to embed existing files has been created."
I am a logged in user with the "test_super_admin" user

elements.name: Upload the "Embed Flag Earth" file.

steps.name: I should see "Allowed types: png gif jpg jpeg."
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth in space" for "field_image[0][alt]"
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth all earth in space" for "field_image[0][title]"
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth" for "Media name"
I should see the "Edit" in the "Embed Flag Earth" row
I am a logged in user with the "test_super_admin" user

elements.name: Check if we are able to embed existing files library in the rich text editor.

steps.name: I fill in "Test Basic page to embed existing files" for "Title"
I should see "Test Basic page to embed existing files"
I click "Test Basic page to embed existing files"
I should see "Test Basic page body to embed existing files"
I should see "Edit Basic page Test Basic page to embed existing files"
I move focus to "Body" rich text editor field
I click the editor media browser command button
I wait for AJAX to finish
the editor media browser should be open
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth" for "Search keywords"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see image with the "Embed Flag Earth all earth in space" title text
I double click on the image with the "Embed Flag Earth all earth in space" title text
I wait for AJAX to finish
I wait for AJAX to finish
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth custom Caption text" for "Caption"
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth custom Alt text" for "Alternative text"
I fill in "Embed Flag Earth custom title" for "Title"
I click "Embed" in the "button" element with the "class" attribute set to "button button--primary js-form-submit form-submit ui-button ui-widget ui-state-default ui-corner-all ui-button-text-only"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see image with the "Embed Flag Earth all earth in space" title text

name: File & Media Management - Assets Management - Ability to embed existing media image library in the rich text editor
description:
As a content admin
I want to be able to embed existing files from the library of files in the CKEditor
So that it will show up under that rich text field without having to upload the image for each content

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user

elements.name: Check if content admins can access the content files page.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user

elements.name: Check if we do have a file named "Flag Earth" , if not then upload the file dependently.

steps.name: I should see "Allowed types: png gif jpg jpeg."
I fill in "Flag Earth in space" for "field_image[0][alt]"
I fill in "Flag Earth all earth in space" for "field_image[0][title]"
I fill in "Flag Earth" for "Media name"
I should see the "Edit" in the "Flag Earth" row
I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user

elements.name: Check if content admins can edit files.

steps.name: I fill in "Flag Earth" for "Media name"
I should see "Edit Image Flag Earth"
I fill in "Flag Earth after edit" for "Media name"
I should see "Image Flag Earth after edit has been updated."
I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user

elements.name: Check if content admins can delete files.

steps.name: I fill in "Flag Earth after edit" for "Media name"
I wait for AJAX to finish
I should see "Flag Earth after edit"
I should see "Flag Earth after edit"
I should see "This action cannot be undone."
I should see "The media Flag Earth after edit has been deleted."

name: File & Media Management - Assets Management - Image media and their usage list page for site admins
description:
As a user with permission to manage files in the site
I want to be able to see the list of files
So that I will be able to manage files, see where they have been used in contents.

elements.name: Check if the webmaster user UID 1 can masquerade as any user.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user
I fill in "test_authenticated" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_editor" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_content_admin" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_site_admin" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_super_admin" for "Name or email contains"

I fill in "test_authenticated" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_editor" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_content_admin" for "Name or email contains"
I fill in "test_site_admin" for "Name or email contains"

elements.name: Check if a site admin user can NOT masquerade as any user.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I should not see "Masquerade as webmaster"
I fill in "test_authenticated" for "Name or email contains"
I should not see "Masquerade as test_authenticated"
I fill in "test_editor" for "Name or email contains"
I should not see "Masquerade as test_editor"
I fill in "test_content_admin" for "Name or email contains"
I should not see "Masquerade as test_content_admin"

elements.name: Check if a content admin user can NOT masquerade as the super user (UID 1) "webmaster".

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_content_admin" user
I should not see "Masquerade as webmaster"

elements.name: Check if an editor user can NOT masquerade as the super user (UID 1) "webmaster".

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_editor" user
I should not see "Masquerade as webmaster"

elements.name: Check if an authenticated user can NOT masquerade as the super user (UID 1) "webmaster".

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_authenticated" user
I should not see "Masquerade as webmaster"

name: Support Requirements - Standard Support Navigation - Allow site super administrators to switch users and surf the site as that user.
description:
As the site super admin
I want to be able to switch users and surf the site as that user with no password required
So that I can see what is the selected user is seeing in the site then switch back to my own user account at any time.

elements.name: Add the Test Basic page root page to the main menu.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Test Basic page root title" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test Basic page root body"
I check the box "Provide a menu link"
I should see "Basic page Test Basic page root title has been created."
I should see "Test Basic page root body"

elements.name: Add the Test Basic page sub 1, then check the breadcrumb.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Test Basic page sub 1 title" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test Basic page sub 1 body"
I check the box "Provide a menu link"
I select "Test Basic page root title" from "Parent item"
I should see "Basic page Test Basic page sub 1 title has been created."
I should see "Test Basic page sub 1 body"
I should see "Test Basic page root title" in the "ol" element with the "class" attribute set to "breadcrumb"

elements.name: Add the Test Basic page sub 2, then check the breadcrumb.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "Test Basic page sub 2 title" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test Basic page sub 2 body"
I check the box "Provide a menu link"
I select "Test Basic page sub 1 title" from "Parent item"
I should see "Basic page Test Basic page sub 2 title has been created."
I should see "Test Basic page sub 2 body"
I should see "Test Basic page sub 1 title" in the "ol" element with the "class" attribute set to "breadcrumb"
I should see "Test Basic page root title" in the "ol" element with the "class" attribute set to "breadcrumb"

name: Navigational Features - Breadcrumbs - Standard breadcrumbs
description:
As a Visitor to the site
I want to be able to see the back path
So that I can see path I followed to locate the current page usually near the top of the page

elements.name: Create "Test Content" content type.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user
I should see "The content type Test Content has been added."

elements.name: Add Test content N1, N2, N3, N4 type of test content.

I fill in "Test content N1" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test content N1 Body"
I should see "Test Content Test content N1 has been created."
I fill in "Test content N2" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test content N2 Body"
I should see "Test Content Test content N2 has been created."
I fill in "Test content N3" for "Title"
I fill in the rich text editor field "Body" with "Test content N3 Body"
I should see "Test Content Test content N3 has been created."

elements.name: Add Test content N1, N2, N3, N4 nodes to the "Test Queue" entityqueue.

I fill in "Test content N2" for "items[1][target_id]"
I should see "2 items" in the "Test Queue" row
I click "Edit items" in the "Test Queue" row
I should see "Edit subqueue Test Queue"
I fill in "Test content N3" for "items[2][target_id]"
I should see "3 items" in the "Test Queue" row

name: Add default [entityqueue] module testing content and configuration.

elements.name: Check that Reverse order in admin view is working.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user
I click "Edit items" in the "Test Queue" row
I should see "Edit subqueue Test Queue"
I should see "Test content N1" value in the "edit-items-0-target-id" input element
I should see "Test content N2" value in the "edit-items-1-target-id" input element
I should see "Test content N3" value in the "edit-items-2-target-id" input element
I should see "Restrict this queue to a minimum of"
I should see "Reverse order in admin view"
I check the box "Reverse order in admin view"
I should see "The entity queue Test Queue has been updated."
I click "Edit items" in the "Test Queue" row
I should see "Edit subqueue Test Queue"
I should see "Test content N3" value in the "edit-items-0-target-id" input element
I should see "Test content N2" value in the "edit-items-1-target-id" input element
I should see "Test content N1" value in the "edit-items-2-target-id" input element

name: Module Requirements - Standard Entity Queue Management - Have the option to Reverse order in admin view.
description:
As a logged in user with a permisstioto manage entityqueues 
I well be able to view the order of entities in entity queues in a reverse order.
So that they will have a flipped order at the front-end.

elements.name: Check if queuable content have the "Entityqueue" tab at the full content page and can Add to queue or Remove from queue.

I wait for AJAX to finish
I wait for AJAX to finish

name: Module Requirements - Standard Entity Queue Management - Have Entityqueue tab inside the full content page and be able to Add to a queue or Remove from a queue
description:
As a logged in user with a permission to manage entity queues
I well be able to see an Entityqueue tab inside the full content page of a selected content
So that I can Add to queue or Remove from queue for the content.

elements.name: Check if Super Admins can access the Coffee search box to navigate fast between admin pages.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_authenticated" user

name: Module Requirements - Standard Back-End Navigation - Navigate through the Drupal admin with the keyboard for faster access
description:
As a site admin
I want to be able to navigate through the Drupal admin with the keyboard
So that I will have a faster access to administration pages in the site.

elements.name: Check the persistent login configuration.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user
I should see "30" value in the "edit-lifetime" input element
I should see "0" value in the "edit-max-tokens" input element

elements.name: Check if an authenticated user can login and use the [Remember me] option.

name: user requirements - Have persistent login options and configurations.
description:
As a user which can login to the site.
  I want to have the option to have "Remember Me" option on the user login form.
  So I can persistent my login session independent of setting of a long session lifetime.

elements.name: Check if the "test_authenticated" user is not blocked. and can login.
Check if the site admin can Administer users and disable a User account "test_authenticated" from accessing the site.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "test_site_admin" user
I fill in "test_authenticated" for "Name or email contains"
I should see "The changes have been saved."

elements.name: Check if the blocked user with user id of <Test Blocked User ID> can or can not login.

steps.name: I should see "The username test_authenticated has not been activated or is blocked."

name: User Management - Standard User Management - Admins can disable users
description:
As a site admin user
I want to be able Block user accounts
So that they will be disabled and not be able to use the site.

elements.name: Check the Role Assign configuration.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user
the "Content Admin" checkbox should be checked
the "Site Admin" checkbox should be checked

name: User Management - Standard User Management - Users with permission to assign roles may select which roles are available for assignment.
description:
As a logged in site admin and a permission to Assign roles
I will be able to assign roles to other users.
So that only users with permission to assign roles may select which roles are available for assignment

elements.name: Check the User protect configuration.

steps.name: I am a logged in user with the "webmaster" user

name: User Management - Standard User Management - Have fine-grained access control of user administrators protections with specific user, or all users in a role.
description:
As a logged in site admin
I will be allowed to fine-grained access control of user administrators
So that the protections can be specific to a user, or applied to all users in a role.
